lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Note.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Note.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Represents a task with a deadline.
* A Deadline has a description and a due date or time.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param by the due date or time for the task
* Returns the due date or time of this Deadline.
* @return the due date or time as a String
* Returns the type icon of this task.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task, including
* its type, status, description, and due date.
* @return a string representation of the task
* Represents a task that occurs within a specific time frame.
* An Event has a description, a start time, and an end time.
* @param description the description of the event
* @param from the start time or date of the event
* @param to the end time or date of the event
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* The Note class represents a simple command-line task manager chatbot.
* Delegates responsibilities to Ui, TaskList, Parser, and Storage.

"\nNow you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");

* Represents a generic task with a description and a completion status.
* This is the base class for specific task types such as Todo, Deadline, and Event.
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* By default, the task is not done.
* @param description the description of the task
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* Returns the type icon of the task.
* Default is a blank space; subclasses override this method.
* @return a string representing the task type
* Represents a Todo task, which is a task without any date/time constraints.
* Inherits from the base Task class.
* Constructs a new Todo task with the given description.
* @param description the description of the todo task
* Returns the type icon of the task.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Bye! Hope to see you again soon!");
* Helper method to match the new toString format:
* "[status][type] description" or with extra info for Deadline/Event.
